intro: Serapias mascaensis, commonly known as the Mascarene serapias, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the genus Serapias within the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers, which are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It thrives in rocky and coastal habitats, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Serapias mascaensis is considered a rare and endemic species.
